Thanks Yanshosh. That rule will work.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> Hmm.. I think the Predacon base can move this one time, as the 
> Alliance base also moved. Alliance moved, Preds moved, and I think 
> that should be enough. How about we say that Maximals have a base 
> move left, and put this following rule into effect (I'd like to 
hear 
> everyone's oppinion on this):
> 
> Since the mobile base rule has been really hazy lately, and since 
> repealing it will lead to what was happening before it was put into 
> effect, how about we ban anything mobile but one to three bot 
> transports or the like. No shuttles, no subs, not flying bases, no 
> space cruisers, only small transports. That way there's no way it 
can 
> be a base (how can a three man transport be a base?).
> 
> How does that sound? It'll clear alot of confusion.
> 
> 
> Bell just rang, GTG.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > OK, well, then that just shot that idea out the window didn't it? 
> OK, 
> > then what would you suggest we have happen at this point to keep 
> the 
> > story line going? 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Lord Unitron" <KSLawdogg@c...> wrote:
> > > (No mobile bases are the rules, whether they attack or not)
